snippet: The ruling generals have cast the national vote as essential to restoring democracy, but critics say the proposal would weaken the role of elected officials....
abstract: Thailand's ruling junta plans national referendum on new constitution it asserts is necessary to reestablish democracy, but which critics see as bid by military to consolidate its power; authorities have suppressed opposition to proposed constitution and banned party election monitors.
lead_paragraph: The ruling generals have cast the national vote as essential to restoring democracy, but critics say the proposal would weaken the role of elected officials.

headline.main: Thailand Junta Seeks to Extend Its Power With Constitutional Referendum
headline.print_headline: Thai Junta Seeks to Extend Power With Vote on a New Constitution
